Definition at line 166 of file cparser_line.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_line_delete ( cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Delete a character from the line buffer immediately before the current position.

The current position is moved back by one.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to a parser structure.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if inputs are invalid; CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST if the line buffer is empty.

Definition at line 96 of file cparser_line.c.

char  ch 
)

Insert a character into a line buffer at the current position.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to a parser structure.
ch Character to be inserted.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if inputs are invalid; CPARSER_ERR_OUT_OF_RES if the line buffer is full.

Definition at line 57 of file cparser_line.c.

short cparser_line_last ( const cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Return the last position of the current line.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
Last position of the current line. This index points to the terminating NULL character of the current line.

int  print_prompt,
int  new_line 
)

Print the current line including the current line.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
print_prompt 1 if the parser prompt should be printed first.
new_line 1 if a linefeed should be printed first; 0 otherwise.
Returns:
None. Crash on failure.
